message.content:
cs.MA, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.CE 

This paper presents an extension of the Open Traffic Models platform for running macroscopic traffic simulations in high-performance computing environments. The paper focuses on the use of distributed computing and message-passing interface for inter-process communication. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.MA (Multiagent Systems) which deals with the study of distributed systems and multi-agent interactions. The paper also deals with network partitioning, which could fall under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) or cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The use of high-performance computing also suggests cs.SY (Systems and Control) as a possible category. Finally, the application of the simulation to traffic scenarios suggests cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) as another possible category.
